GitHub Marketplace Listing Guideïƒ

This document provides information for listing SecretSync on the GitHub Marketplace as a verified free action.

Marketplace Informationïƒ

Basic Informationïƒ

Name: SecretSync
Tagline: Universal secrets synchronization pipeline for multi-cloud secret management
Category: Deployment and Continuous Integration
Pricing: Free

Descriptionïƒ

SecretSync provides fully automated, real-time secret synchronization between HashiCorp Vault and AWS. Perfect for multi-account AWS environments, HashiCorp Vault users, and organizations managing secrets across AWS Organizations.

Key Features:

  • ğŸ”„ Two-phase pipeline architecture (merge â†’ sync)

  • ğŸ¯ Vault-to-AWS secrets synchronization

  • ğŸŒ Multi-account AWS secret management

  • ğŸ“Š GitHub-native diff annotations in PRs

  • ğŸ”’ OIDC authentication for AWS (no long-lived credentials)

  • ğŸš€ Dynamic target discovery via AWS Organizations/Identity Center

  • âš¡ Zero-configuration Docker action

  • ğŸ” Complete privacy - no data collection

Supported Storesïƒ

  • HashiCorp Vault (KV2) - source

  • AWS Secrets Manager - target

  • AWS S3 (merge store option)

  • Kubernetes Secrets (operator mode)

Marketplace Requirements Checklistïƒ

âœ… Technical Requirementsïƒ

  • action.yml file: Present in repository root

  • Docker-based action: Uses Dockerfile for containerization

  • Valid inputs: All inputs properly documented with descriptions

  • Branding: Icon and color specified

  • Multi-arch support: Supports linux/amd64 and linux/arm64

âœ… Documentation Requirementsïƒ

  • README.md: Comprehensive documentation with examples

  • Usage examples: Complete workflow examples

  • Input documentation: All inputs documented with defaults

  • Quick start guide: Easy getting started section

  • Advanced examples: Multiple use case examples

âœ… Legal and Policy Requirementsïƒ

  • License: MIT License (permissive, OSI-approved)

  • Privacy Policy: See docs/PRIVACY.md

  • Support Information: See docs/SUPPORT.md

  • Security Policy: See docs/SECURITY.md

  • Code of Conduct: Implicit in professional conduct

âœ… Quality Requirementsïƒ

  • Working action: Fully functional and tested

  • Error handling: Proper error messages and exit codes

  • Logging: Comprehensive logging with multiple formats

  • Security: No hardcoded secrets, proper secret handling

  • Performance: Efficient execution with parallel processing

âœ… Marketplace Best Practicesïƒ

  • Semantic versioning: Using git tags (v1, v1.0.0, etc.)

  • Clear naming: Descriptive and searchable name

  • Useful description: Clear value proposition

  • Good documentation: Step-by-step guides and examples

  • Community support: GitHub Issues and Discussions

  • Regular updates: Active maintenance and improvements

Publishing to Marketplaceïƒ

Prerequisitesïƒ

  1. Repository Requirements

    • Public repository on GitHub

    • Valid action.yml in root directory

    • Proper branding (icon, color)

    • Comprehensive README

  2. Legal Requirements

    • License file (MIT)

    • Privacy policy

    • Support contact information

    • Security policy

  3. Quality Requirements

    • Working action with examples

    • No security vulnerabilities

    • Proper error handling

    • Good documentation

Publishing Stepsïƒ

  1. Verify Action Works

    # Test action locally
act -j test-action

  2. Create Version Tags

    # Create and push version tags
git tag -a v1.0.0 -m "Release v1.0.0"
git push origin v1.0.0

# Create major version tag (recommended for users)
git tag -fa v1 -m "Release v1"
git push origin v1 --force

  3. Publish to Marketplace

    • Go to repository on GitHub

    • Click â€œReleasesâ€

    • Click â€œDraft a new releaseâ€

    • Choose the version tag (e.g., v1.0.0)

    • Check â€œPublish this Action to the GitHub Marketplaceâ€

    • Select primary category: â€œDeploymentâ€

    • Add release notes

    • Click â€œPublish releaseâ€

  4. Verify Listing

    • Visit: https://github.com/marketplace/actions/secretsync

    • Verify all information is correct

    • Test the action from Marketplace

Recommended Version Tagsïƒ

# Semantic version (specific)
v1.0.0, v1.0.1, v1.1.0, v2.0.0

# Major version (for users - auto-updates)
v1, v2

# Example: Release v1.2.3
git tag -a v1.2.3 -m "Release v1.2.3 - Add OIDC support"
git push origin v1.2.3

# Update major version pointer
git tag -fa v1 -m "Update v1 to v1.2.3"
git push origin v1 --force

Marketplace Metadataïƒ

Action Metadata (action.yml)ïƒ

name: 'SecretSync'
description: 'Universal secrets synchronization pipeline for multi-cloud secret management with Vault, AWS, GCP, and more'
author: 'jbcom'

branding:
  icon: 'lock'
  color: 'blue'

Marketing Copyïƒ

Short Description (200 chars)ïƒ

Vault-to-AWS secrets sync. Two-phase pipeline with inheritance, dynamic discovery via AWS Organizations/Identity Center & GitHub-native diffs. Free, open source.

Long Descriptionïƒ

SecretSync revolutionizes Vault-to-AWS secrets management with a powerful two-phase pipeline architecture. Built for organizations managing secrets across multiple AWS accounts with HashiCorp Vault as the source of truth.

Perfect For:

  • Multi-account AWS environments (Control Tower, Organizations)

  • HashiCorp Vault users syncing to AWS Secrets Manager

  • Teams managing secrets across dev/staging/prod

  • Organizations requiring secret inheritance hierarchies

  • DevOps teams automating secret distribution

Key Benefits:

ğŸ”„ Two-Phase Architecture Merge secrets from multiple Vault paths, then sync to multiple AWS accounts with inheritance support.

ğŸ¯ Vault â†’ AWS Sync HashiCorp Vault (KV2) as source, AWS Secrets Manager as target, with S3 or Vault merge store options.

ğŸŒ AWS-Native Patterns First-class support for AWS Control Tower, Organizations, and Identity Center patterns.

ğŸ“Š GitHub-Native Integration Automatic PR annotations, diff reporting, and status checks.

ğŸ”’ Security First OIDC authentication, no long-lived credentials, complete audit trail, zero data collection.

ğŸš€ Dynamic Discovery Automatically discover and sync to accounts via AWS Organizations or Identity Center.

Use Cases:

  1. Control Tower Environments: Sync secrets to all AWS accounts in your organization

  2. Vault Distribution: Push Vault secrets to AWS Secrets Manager across accounts

  3. Secret Inheritance: Dev â†’ Staging â†’ Production with automatic propagation

  4. Multi-Region: Sync secrets across AWS regions from central Vault

  5. Compliance: Automated secret rotation with complete audit trail

Zero Configuration Just add your config file and secrets - the action handles the rest.

Verification Requirementsïƒ

For verified publisher status:

  1. Organization Account: Must be published from an organization (not personal)

  2. Email Verification: Organization email must be verified

  3. 2FA Enabled: Two-factor authentication required

  4. Quality Standards: Meet all GitHub Marketplace quality requirements

  5. Active Maintenance: Regular updates and responsive support

Monitoring and Maintenanceïƒ

Post-Publication Tasksïƒ

  1. Monitor Issues: Respond to bug reports and questions

  2. Track Usage: Use GitHubâ€™s marketplace insights

  3. Regular Updates: Keep action up-to-date with dependencies

  4. Security Patches: Respond quickly to security issues

  5. Documentation: Keep docs updated with new features

Marketplace Insightsïƒ

Track these metrics:

  • Daily/monthly active users

  • Total installations

  • Popular use cases (from issues/discussions)

  • User feedback and ratings

  • Common problems/questions

Compliance and Policiesïƒ

Data Privacyïƒ

SecretSync is privacy-by-design:

  • âœ… No data collection

  • âœ… No external network calls (except to userâ€™s configured services)

  • âœ… No telemetry or analytics

  • âœ… Complete user control

  • âœ… Open source and auditable

See Privacy Policy for details.

Securityïƒ

  • Regular dependency updates

  • CodeQL scanning enabled

  • Security policy documented

  • Responsible disclosure process

  • No known vulnerabilities

See Security Policy for details.

Frequently Asked Questionsïƒ

Can I publish beta/pre-release versions?ïƒ

Yes! Use pre-release tags:

git tag -a v1.0.0-beta.1 -m "Beta release"

How do I unpublish from Marketplace?ïƒ

You can delist the action in your repository settings under â€œMarketplaceâ€.

Can I charge for this action?ïƒ

This action is MIT licensed and free. Paid versions require different licensing.

How do version tags work?ïƒ

Users can reference:

  • @v1 - Latest v1.x.x (auto-updates)

  • @v1.2.3 - Specific version (pinned)

  • @main - Latest commit (not recommended)

What if my action has dependencies?ïƒ

Docker actions (like this one) bundle all dependencies in the container.
